bwwExcerpt: Elling has just enough edge to keep itself from falling into a sugar coma; the story's already mild politics have been muted to a murmur in this adaptation. But its message about the relationship of a civil society (scaled-back, perhaps, but still essentially progressive and humane) with the weird and irreducible individuals who constitute it-namely, that there needn't be an apocalyptic showdown between the two-is nothing short of revolutionary in the current zero
